column4: whenever i type apt in the terminal it says command not found and i dont have an /etc/apt/preferences file but the program apt is installed. what do i do?
apt in itself is not a command.
nope.. never heard of it.. my mistake sorry
try typing apt into a linux install
I try not to sound rude but I'm sure exactly what you're trying to achieve..
type *not* sure. what would you like to do?
im not really trying to acheive anything except get answers
I mean what would you like to do? install a package?
no i want to use the command apt depends which maps out software dependencies
and i know to install software i can just type apt-get install
actually i got half of it because apt depends is a real command. but thanks, honestly.
oh and one more for you. how do i add the action for nautilus to delete files and folders?
